p: To better understand the mechanism of action of F. vulgare essential oil, we have investigated its hemolytic effect. The result of hemolytic activity indicates that the oil is able to lyse the cell membrane albeit with a rather high IC 50 value of 1100 mg L âˆ’1 ( Table 3). Moreover, in order to investigate the effect of essential oil on the cell morphology, the images of untreated and treated CCRF cells with essential oil were captured by fluorescence microscope. The images are illustrated in Figure 2.
